intro: Kosteletzkya macrantha f. lignosa, commonly known as the woody costmary, is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its woody stems and aromatic foliage. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is native to the southern United States, particularly Texas and Louisiana. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue and produces yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and prairies. Its fragrant leaves and showy flowers make it a valuable addition to native gardens and ecological landscapes.
